verses.text: And the LORD spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying,

When a man shall have in the skin of his flesh a rising, a scab, or bright spot, and it be in the skin of his flesh \add like\add* the plague of leprosy; then he shall be brought to Aaron the priest, or to one of his sons the priests:

And the priest shall look on the plague in the skin of the flesh: and \add when\add* the hair in the plague is turned white, and the plague in sight \add is\add* deeper than the skin of his flesh, it \add is\add* a plague of leprosy: and the priest shall look on him, and pronounce him unclean.

If the bright spot \add is\add* white in the skin of his flesh, and in sight, not deeper than the skin, and the hair of it not turned white; then the priest shall shut up \add him that hath\add* the plague seven days:

And the priest shall look on him the seventh day: and behold, \add if\add* the plague in his sight is at a stay, \add and\add* the plague spreadeth not in the skin; then the priest shall shut him up seven days more:

And the priest shall look on him again the seventh day: and behold, \add if\add* the plague \add is\add* somewhat dark, \add and\add* the plague spreadeth not in the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean: it \add is but\add* a scab: and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.
But if the scab shall spread much in the skin, after he hath been seen by the priest for his cleansing, he shall be seen by the priest again:
And \add if\add* the priest shall see, that behold, the scab spreadeth in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it \add is\add* a leprosy.
When the plague of leprosy is in a man, then he shall be brought to the priest:
And the priest shall see \add him\add* : and behold, \add if\add* the rising \add is\add* white in the skin, and it hath turned the hair white, and \add there is\add* raw flesh in the rising;
It \add is\add* an old leprosy in the skin of his flesh, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean, and shall not shut him up; for he \add is\add* unclean.
And if a leprosy shall break out in the skin, and the leprosy shall cover all the skin of \add him that hath\add* the plague from his head even to his foot, wherever the priest looketh;

Then the priest shall consider: and behold, \add if\add* the leprosy hath covered all his flesh, he shall pronounce \add him\add* clean \add that hath\add* the plague: it is all turned white: he \add is\add* clean.
But when raw flesh appeareth in him, he shall be unclean.
And the priest shall see the raw flesh, and pronounce him to be unclean: \add for\add* the raw flesh \add is\add* unclean: it \add is\add* a leprosy.
Or if the raw flesh shall turn again, and be changed into white, he shall come to the priest;
And the priest shall see him: and behold, \add if\add* the plague is turned into white: then the priest shall pronounce \add him\add* clean \add that hath\add* the plague: he \add is\add* clean.
The flesh also, in which, \add even\add* in the skin of it, was a boil, and is healed,
And in the place of the boil there shall be a white rising, or a bright spot, white, and somewhat reddish, and it be showed to the priest;

And if, when the priest seeth it, behold, it \add is\add* in sight lower than the skin, and the hair of it \add is\add* turned white; the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it \add is\add* a plague of leprosy broken out of the boil.

But if the priest shall look on it, and behold, \add there are\add* no white hairs in it, and \add if\add* it \add is\add* not lower than the skin, but somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days:
And if it hath spread much in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it \add is\add* a plague.
But if the bright spot shall stay in its place, \add and\add* not spread, it \add is\add* a burning boil; and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
Or if there \add is any\add* flesh, in the skin of which \add there is\add* a hot burning, and the live \add flesh\add* that burneth hath a white bright spot, somewhat reddish or white;

Then the priest shall look upon it: and behold, \add if\add* the hair in the bright spot \add is\add* turned white, and it \add is in\add* sight deeper than the skin: it \add is\add* a leprosy broken out of the burning: wherefore the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it \add is\add* the plague of leprosy.

But if the priest shall look on it, and behold, \add there is\add* no white hair in the bright spot, and it \add is\add* no lower than the \add other\add* skin, but \add is\add* somewhat dark; then the priest shall shut him up seven days:
And the priest shall look upon him the seventh day: \add and\add* if it \add is\add* spread much in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it \add is\add* the plague of leprosy,

And if the bright spot shall stay in its place, \add and\add* not spread in the skin, but \add be\add* somewhat dark; it \add is\add* a rising of the burning, and the priest shall pronounce him clean: for it \add is\add* an inflammation of the burning.
If a man or woman shall have a plague upon the head or the beard;

Then the priest shall see the plague: and behold, if it \add is\add* in sight deeper than the skin, \add and there is\add* in it a yellow thin hair; then the priest shall pronounce him unclean: it \add is\add* a dry scall, \add even\add* a leprosy upon the head or beard.

And if the priest shall look on the plague of the scall, and behold, it \add is\add* not in sight deeper than the skin, and no black hair in it; then the priest shall shut up \add him that hath\add* the plague of the scall seven days:

And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the plague: and behold, \add if\add* the scall spreadeth not, and there is in it no yellow hair, and the scall \add is\add* not in sight deeper than the skin;
He shall be shaven, but the scall shall he not shave; and the priest shall shut up \add him that hath\add* the scall seven days more:

And in the seventh day the priest shall look on the scall: and behold, \add if\add* the scall is not spread in the skin, nor \add is\add* in sight deeper than the skin; then the priest shall pronounce him clean: and he shall wash his clothes, and be clean.
But if the scall shall spread much in the skin after his cleansing;
Then the priest shall look on him: and behold, if the scall is spread in the skin, the priest shall not seek for yellow hair; he \add is\add* unclean.
But if the scall shall be in his sight at a stay, and there is black hair grown in it; the scall is healed, he \add is\add* clean: and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
If a man also or a woman shall have in the skin of their flesh bright spots, \add even\add* white bright spots;

Then the priest shall look: and behold, \add if\add* the bright spots in the skin of their flesh \add are\add* darkish white; it \add is\add* a freckled spot \add that\add* groweth in the skin; he \add is\add* clean.
And the man whose hair hath fallen off his head, he \add is\add* bald; \add yet is\add* he clean.
And he that hath his hair fallen off from the part of his head towards his face, he \add is\add* forehead-bald; \add yet is\add* he clean.
And if there is in the bald head, or bald forehead, a white reddish sore; \add it is\add* a leprosy sprung up on his bald head, or his bald forehead.
Then the priest shall look upon it: and behold, \add if\add* the rising of the sore is white reddish on his bald head, or on his bald forehead, as the leprosy appeareth in the skin of the flesh;
He is a leprous man, he \add is\add* unclean: the priest shall pronounce him utterly unclean; his plague \add is\add* in his head.
And the leper in whom the plague \add is\add* , his clothes shall be rent, and his head bare, and he shall put a covering upon his upper lip, and shall cry, Unclean, unclean.
All the days in which the plague \add shall be\add* in him he shall be defiled; he \add is\add* unclean: he shall dwell alone, without the camp \add shall\add* his habitation \add be\add* .
The garment also that the plague of leprosy is in, \add whether\add* a woolen garment, or a linen garment;
Whether in the warp, or woof, of linen, or of woolen: whether in a skin, or in any thing made of skin:

And if the plague is greenish or reddish in the garment, or in the skin, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin: it \add is\add* a plague of leprosy, and shall be shown to the priest:
And the priest shall look upon the plague, and shut up \add that which hath\add* the plague seven days:

And he shall look on the plague on the seventh day: if the plague is spread in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, \add or\add* in a skin, \add or\add* in any work that is made of skin: the plague \add is\add* a fretting leprosy; it \add is\add* unclean.
He shall therefore burn that garment, whether warp or woof, in woolen or in linen, or any thing of skin, in which the plague is: for it \add is\add* a fretting leprosy; it shall be burnt in the fire.
And if the priest shall look, and behold, the plague is not spread in the garment, either in the warp or in the woof, or in any thing of skin;
Then the priest shall command that they wash \add the thing\add* in which the plague \add is\add* , and he shall shut it up seven days more:

And the priest shall look on the plague after it is washed: and behold, \add if\add* the plague hath not changed its color, and the plague hath not spread; it \add is\add* unclean; thou shalt burn it in the fire; it \add is\add* fret inward, \add whether\add* it \add is\add* bare within or without.

And if the priest shall look, and behold, the plague \add is\add* somewhat dark after the washing of it; then he shall rend it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof:

And if it shall appear still in the garment, either in the warp, or in the woof, or in any thing of skin; it \add is\add* a spreading \add plague\add* : thou shalt burn that in which the plague \add is\add* , with fire.

And the garment, either warp, or woof, or whatever thing of skin \add it is\add* , which thou shalt wash, if the plague hath departed from them, then it shall be washed the second time, and shall be clean.
This \add is\add* the law of the plague of leprosy in a garment of woolen or linen, either in the warp or woof, or any thing of skins, to pronounce it clean, or to pronounce it unclean.
